sentence.Network_en: Husband and wife were similarly successful in their chosen careers.
sentence.Network_cn: 夫妇俩在各自所选择的事业上都很成功。

entry.tran: 类似地;相似地;差不多地
entry.def: You use similarly to say that something is similar to something else.

example.ex: Most of the men who now gathered round him again were similarly dressed.
example.tran: 现在再次聚集到他周围的人穿戴大都差不多。

entry.def: You use similarly when mentioning a fact or situation that is similar to the one you have just mentioned.

example.ex: A mother recognises the feel of her child's skin when blindfolded. Similarly, she can instantly identify her baby's cry.
example.tran: 即便是蒙上眼睛母亲也能摸出自己孩子的肌肤。同样地，母亲也能立即听出自己孩子的哭声。

sentences.sentence: "some people have little power to do good, and have likewise little strength to resist evil"- Samuel Johnson

stems_affixes.word_buile: simil相类似,一样+ar……的→adj.[to]相似的,类似的
veri=very+similar[adj.[to]相似的,类似的]→非常相似
similar[adj.[to]相似的,类似的]+ly表副词→adv.同样地, 类似于
dis不+simil相类似,一样+ation表名词→不相同
fac事实+simil相类似,一样+e→实际一样→眷写
similar[adj.[to]相似的,类似的]+ity表名词→n.类似,相似;类似点
as不断+simil相同+ate表动词→成为相同→同化

Sentence.sentence: Teenagers in Australia, similarly ,said that their mobile phones provided numerous benefits and were an affiliated part of their lives; some were so attached to their phones that the researchers considered it an addiction.

sentences.en: He was late and I similarly was delayed.
sentences.cn: 他迟到了, 我也晚了。
